Posts.EditableText: Why is it that when you submit a new game the 'category' is never allocated instantly? It's always placed under 'Uncategorised' although in the past it could take a day to categorize a game. I just submitted a CYOA game under 'horror' yesterday and it's still stating it's 'uncategorised' and not appearing under the menu of Latest Games.
Posts.HTML:
Why is it that when you submit a new game the 'category' is never allocated instantly?

It's always placed under 'Uncategorised' although in the past it could take a day to categorize a game.

I just submitted a CYOA game under 'horror' yesterday and it's still stating it's 'uncategorised' and not appearing under the menu of Latest Games.

Posts.EditableText: It's because Alex moderates the submissions before they get listed on the site. He's likely just been too busy to get to it yet.
Posts.HTML: It's because Alex moderates the submissions before they get listed on the site. He's likely just been too busy to get to it yet.

Posts.EditableText: Just been through the list now I was away for a couple of days. If anybody wants to volunteer to be a moderator then please let me know. It's a simple task, when you have moderator privileges you get a dropdown on a game page where you can assign the category, and there's a page for uncategorised games so it's pretty quick to go through - I put anything that's clearly been knocked up in the space of a few minutes into "Sandpit", and everything else generally goes into the category the author suggested when submitting. So please drop me an email if you don't mind checking the uncategorised page from time to time! There's also an RSS feed so you can be notified of new uploads in Google Reader etc.
Posts.HTML:
Just been through the list now

I was away for a couple of days. If anybody wants to volunteer to be a moderator then please let me know. It's a simple task, when you have moderator privileges you get a dropdown on a game page where you can assign the category, and there's a page for uncategorised games so it's pretty quick to go through - I put anything that's clearly been knocked up in the space of a few minutes into "Sandpit", and everything else generally goes into the category the author suggested when submitting.

So please drop me an email if you don't mind checking the uncategorised page from time to time! There's also an RSS feed so you can be notified of new uploads in Google Reader etc.
